tweets.text:
BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

So it's a CRITICAL TEST CASE for environmental enforcement by @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

No-one wants the repercussions of their household waste being flytipped. 

Find out how you can avoid this happening, by watching our video: https://t.co/SFxSL7yhLZ #flytipping #waste

Trees deserve to be enjoyed by everyone üå≤üå≥ 
 
That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre giving ¬£3.9 million to #PlantMoreTrees outside of woodlands, in our cities, towns and rivers. 

Watch our video to find out more üëá 

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/PuTzpXtAj9  

@EnvAgency #NationalTreeWeek #TogetherForOurPlanet https://t.co/wNYqkfX3PK
Blimey - action https://t.co/RkO3Psj6hC

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

We want the River Stour to be a more accessible, wildlife-rich space. We'll run projects that will see local communities becoming aware of, passionate about & proud of their river. Support us to win funding by RTing & sharing #BBCWildlifexEcover
#FertilisetheFuture @EcoverUK https://t.co/SBculKxJxT
What a disgrace. I hope the ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© throw the book at this environmental vandal  https://t.co/SMeYRBit97

@craig73webster @EnvAgency Ha dredging

Another miserable river scrape down over c. 40 m of bank leading to mass non-natural soil erosion & habitat loss on the Great Ouse. Don't expect this to be good for spawning barbel @EnvAgency https://t.co/5RIOzVVXcc

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @bilgribs I instigated a meeting between Hackney Council and the EA to talk about the river Lea. The EA officer explained that they now have to rely on polluters like Thames Water to report themselves. Imagine how well that‚Äôs going.

urls.title: Environment Agency slashes number of water pollution incident visits
urls.description: Huge drop in number of visits during Covid crisis raises concerns polluters are breaking laws with impunity

tweets.text:
I've often ask the question "And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?"

Transpires we now have an answer. It's not a lot.

"The Environment Agency attended just 292 water pollution incidents, down from 1,726 during the same period in 2019". @bilgribs 

https://t.co/Hbcmxyl5pI

Curiouser and curiouser.

Farmer claims that he was given permission to dredge the riverbed and reprofile the bank by the @EnvAgency "I have been allowed to do by the Environment Agency", he says. (1/2)

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M

Gaywood river horror show continues üí©3 Agricultural runoff incidents at Bawsey @The_WMA @jamesowild @EnvAgencyAnglia @WestNorfolkBC @N_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @WildTroutTrust @WarOnWildlife @Feargal_Sharkey @TheLynnNews @WestNorfolkRob @WNGreens @xrkingslynn https://t.co/LVOgUMucxF
@EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork @yorkshireforum @EnvAgency @YorkshireMuseum What about the hedge?
@EnvAgency Think a lot of flooding is down to a lack of dredging rather than lack of beavers
@EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm Massive hypocrites - the EA is about to bulldoze a chunk of Clifton Ings & Rawcliffe Meadows SSSI in York with plans to destroy more.

5 years since Storm Desmond, the @EnvAgencyNW says new flood defences offer better protection to at least 2,000 properties in Cumbria. It also says more flood protection work is planned for the county over the next five years.

@ayat_soomro @Bruneluni @EnvAgency Hi Ayat-there are no specific Elec. Eng. scholarships. You can view our scholarships at https://t.co/ECSOS4ETfU  You *may*be eligible to apply for a Flood&Coastal MSc, if your Bachelor's degree contained Fluid Mechanics &Hydraulics modules, or you have any related work experience
Five years since #StormDesmond hit #Cumbria, new flood defences are offering better protection to at least 2,000 properties according to the @EnvAgencyNW. https://t.co/RN7hvKsjQV

The @EnvAgency says it's spent ¬£15m over the last five years, maintaining the county's flood defences.

Five years ago this weekend, 5,000 properties were flooded during Storm Desmond, and nearly 800 bridges and more than 180 miles of road were damaged or destroyed. https://t.co/tTvlx5B5CE

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal
Reflection of the sky in the flood water this morning .#floodplain @EnvAgency @ChrisPage90 #ponyhour https://t.co/dBxzJu3YP1

@whiterosegreen @YNET4 @AmyJaneBeer @HerefordshireWT @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland But, that‚Äôs  to create a flood defence. Oh, silly old me thinking an existing  FLOODPLAIN couldn‚Äôt do a better and more visually attractive job.

@CoediogCowboi @EnvAgency @NEYorksNLincs https://t.co/RxFE1paujw
(very lengthy I'm afraid!)

@CoediogCowboi @EnvAgency @NEYorksNLincs The mitigation is based on digging up 10% of the meadow and moving it down the road. @NEYorksNLincs think this is fantastic. They also share an office with the EA.

@CoediogCowboi @EnvAgency @NEYorksNLincs In brief they're knocking down a floodbank and rebuilding it bigger, which will take out part of the SSSI at Clifton Ings & Rawcliffe Meadows. The scheme achieves a marginal uplift in flood protection, which could be delivered in other ways.

@CoediogCowboi @EnvAgency @NEYorksNLincs https://t.co/RxFE1paujw
(very lengthy I'm afraid!)

We‚Äôve had a flood alert from @EnvAgency around the River Ingrebourne this morning, following heavy rain last night. If you have any concerns over flooding, you can call 0345 988 1188, more details https://t.co/VYE8Iqp7VO https://t.co/4o5Vh9oz8e
@whiterosegreen @EnvAgency @NEYorksNLincs Whatt? Can you link?

Given that @EnvAgency (with the collusion of @NEYorksNLincs) is poised to destroy an irreplaceable grassland SSSI in York, maybe these organisations could investigate themselves at the same time? https://t.co/oQ6smyizKl

@sunneofyork @TheMontyDon @GeorgeMonbiot @BeingBoycie @ZacGoldsmith As a Parish Councillor myself I find it hard to believe that the PC would not have been aware of the SSSI status of the site. Also aware that many parish councillors ideas of landscape management can be on the dated side. Time will tell. An unholy mess.

@hertsessexbirds @Ministryofspeak @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I doubt they don't have the resources to send one person down there to have a look same issue as Talgarth when they didn't respond

@Ministryofspeak @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Perhaps my expectations are lower, I think thats quite quick..to organise a response from multiple agency's..
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The alarm was raised on the 24th November, cannot believe its taken this long to respond

@herefordhubbard @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I thought that too! After a hefty fine and repair of damage, a lifelong pledge to care for and maintain a family of beavers on the Lugg

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They should be made to accept beavers on their land with large scale tree planting - won‚Äôt take a couple of beavers long to sort out the devastation & provide numerous habitats for other wildlife. #beavers
@piers_allan @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I give up! I‚Äôm going to the pub to have a scotch egg!

tweets.text: @DanielMacKenzi6 @RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Yes, you're right. If police can get powers of entry easily then they should be able to arrest all involved on site as it happened, this wasn't overnight

@maggie_colledge @RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil But this is a major loss which could have been simply stopped by bringing in the police.

@RichardTreeArt @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Possibly because all funding has been pulled, everyone is stretched beyond decency and there's this covid stuff going on

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Did you know about this on 26th November as reported by the Guardian? In which case why has it taken 9 days to act in he face of such devastation?

@coppullite @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Blast from the past! 

Thanks Pete - hope you‚Äôre keeping well.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil You and your partner agencies have a tough job Dave under the current political regime.  Fight the good fight better days will come. Rember you back at Sapphire new to the EA Pete Whalley

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Thank you! But I, and I'm sure many others, will want to see prosecutions regarding this crime, not just fruitless investigation. We will look forward to your updates üëç

@piers_allan @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil This was done with the consent of the village and the parish council! All completely fed up with the EA s lack of action, in the future I would refrain from commenting on something you obviously know nothing about!
@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The tragedy is if it was a building it could to some extent be replaced, but trees not! Horrendous bloody vandalism!

@DaveThroupEA @NTGates @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Reminds me of what the Thames Water Authority did to the upper Lea in 1979, itll take years to recover, if it ever really does. People may argue differently but to me (and the Water Voles) its never really been the same since

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Now a prosecution needs to follow _and a proper, meaningful one - not some weedly fine or slap on the wrist. This is intentional, wilful, murderous, destruction and the penalty should reflect that. I am so sick of some landowners feeling they are above the law.

@AnabaticW @DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil It‚Äôs all very well villagers and parish councils sanctioning action, but that‚Äôs how witches got burnt in the Middle Ages. We now have laws. Maybe that‚Äôs why the police are involved.

@DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The point I was making is she has paid her taxes and deserves to be protected by an EA that is not frightened of making decisions! There resources would cover the work done by the farmer! They will probably spend more investigating his offence!
@KabwePRQ @LittleMsFossil @EnvAgency I kid you not. EA officer was in the loop and attended relevant Kingsland Parish Council meetings at which matter was discussed. Investigations continue...
@HFmatters @LittleMsFossil @EnvAgency What? Please tell me you are kidding?

@AnabaticW @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well, sure - if you want to split hairs. The point is that, while I have sympathy for your M-i-L's situation the fact she's paid taxes doesn't make her special. The region where she lives votes, consistently, to lower taxes - which is why the EA lacks funds.
@KabwePRQ @LittleMsFossil Unlikely as farmer who bulldozed bank had permission from @EnvAgency. Weep at the sheer incompetence...
@RobGMacfarlane @FreyaLouisa @EnvAgency It‚Äôs not clear who is responsible and what they were trying to achieve
@DanielMacKenzi6 @JuliaBradbury @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Some haven‚Äôt!
